config.question: Which of the following developments in the 1820s and 1830s accompanied the development of political parties?

choices.content: Federalist ideas were abolished during this period.
Antislavery thoughts became prominent in the southern states.
The idea of a loyal opposition became prominent.

answer_3.response: Consider This: This era saw the solidification of the two-party system. By the 1830s, the disappearance of inherited social ranks and clearly defined aristocracies or privileged groups struck European visitors such as Alexis de Tocqueville as the most radical feature of democracy in America. See L.O. 10.1 How did the relationship between the government and the people change during this time?
